title: Replace `ByteStr` with `Arc<str>`

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

body:
## Motivation

Our internal `ByteStr` utility is basically just an `Arc<str>` in disguise. So we probably should just use `Arc<str>` instead.

## Solution

Use `Arc<str>`.

I benchmarked this using the setup posted [here](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/962#issuecomment-1109343311) and saw a small increase in performance. Not very significant though.

title: Remove needless map
body:
```rust
pub(crate) fn new<S>(s: S) -> Self
    where
        S: AsRef<str>,
{
        Self(Bytes::copy_from_slice(s.as_ref().as_bytes()))
}
```
ByteStr receives an AsRef\<str\>. So no longer need to convert &str to String.

title: Add ignore .DS_Store
body:
Here is what the [.DS_Store](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.DS_Store).

I need clean the `.DS_Store` before commit. Add to gitignore could resolve this.

the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

More (simple) examples

## Solution

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

emojied is a fairly simple example with serializing/deserializing data, DB integration via `tokio-postgres`, pooling, TLS configuration, etc. So maybe it'll be a good enough starting point for those trying to figure out how to use it. It doesn't have the best code though.

title: Add `FromExtractor` and deprecate `extractor_middleware`
body: Resolve #954

title: #955: Make community projects stand out as examples
body:
## Motivation

This PR addresses [#955](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/955), which turns out to be a minor edit after discussion with @davidpdrsn. The motivation is to make the community projects "stand out" more when a new `axum` user reads the `README`.

## Solution

Include community project links to showcases and tutorials in the `examples` section.

title: Add 'Rust on Nails' article to Axum ecosystem.
body: Add a link to a blog article on full stack development with rust. https://cloak.software/blog/rust-on-nails/

title: axum: Version 0.5.3
body:
I realized we should keep the changelog entry for the breaking change for version 0.5.2, so added it back here.

Also bumped the version of axum-core to make sure we get the re-export of `AppendHeaders`.

Turns out it was a breaking change.

This reverts commit ca7ecb159bb1bc77c2c3623358ea028b0722e686.

title: helpful note about posting with CORS
body:
Just added a comment.

## Motivation
I've spent some time to find out how to post json data with CORS, and I think this note will be helpful for other newcomers.

title: Fix trailing redirection with query parameters
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

When the request URI matches a route that needs a trailing slash, or has an extra trailing slash, the redirect URI is not generated correctly.

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

This change adds or removes a trailing slash to the path part of the URI, instead of the full URI, preserving query parameters during redirection.

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

This type makes for efficient use of the `?` operator when in a function
with multiple return error types that all implement `IntoResponse`.

title: fix `route` module clippy warning
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->
clippy warning
## Solution
adopt clippy advices

remove `Redirect::permanent(&format!("{}/", req.uri().to_string()))`'s uneeded `to_string()`, because `Uri` already impl `Display` 

remove `Redirect::permanent(&req.uri().to_string().strip_suffix('/').unwrap())`'s `&`, because the  reference be immediately dereferenced by compiler


<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

push all use statement on a mod under `#cfg[unix]` for simplicity.

title: Add `SpaRouter`
body:
This adds `SpaRouter` to axum-extra. It makes it easy to get a routing setup common with single page apps.

Assets will be served using `ServeDir` from a nested path, unknown routes goes to some index file.

title: Add "stream to file" example
body: A few people have asked how to stream requests bodies to a file without buffering everything in memory. So I figure its worth adding an example for. Basically just putting together some combinators that exist already.

title: Add `Field::chunk`
body:
Added the function `chunk` for `exum::extract's multipart Field` to give a clearer option to use rather than try_next.

<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

I needed a way to stream large files from a frontend file uploader directly into a file. These files can be 10gb+ in size, and need to be paused at any time. Though this is doable with try_next, I felt that it was clearer from the user's side to have chunk.

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

## Solution

By implementing the `chunk` function for `axum::extract's multipart Field`, readability of code and nicer access the underlying multer::Field's `chunk` funciton is allowed.

<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->


## Change log
1. Added chunk function to multipart field
2. Changed to doc comment for clarification of usage, and changed `&self` to `&mut self`
3. Fixed formatting
4. Cleaned up nits and correct example to reflex best practices
5. Removed last unwrap

title: `PrivateCookieJar` for managing private cookies
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/896

Its pretty much identical to `SignedCookieJar` but private.

title: Fix `SignedCookieJar` with custom key type
body:
There were several things wrong with it:

- It always extracted `Extension<Key>` instead of using the custom type.
- `IntoResponseParts` was only implemented for `SignedCookieJar<Key>`.

This fixes that and adds a test for it.

## Solution

title: Accept &str for Redirect
body:
## Motivation

`http::Uri` strips URL fragments, which are important for redirects, for example for login flows with access tokens in the fragment.

## Solution

As discussed in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/888, this changes the `Redirect` struct to accept a `&str` instead of a `Uri`.

Resolves #888

title: docs: Add `aliri_tower` as an ecosystem project
body:
## Motivation

Inform users about the `aliri_tower` project. `aliri_tower` provides convenient middleware for validating JWTs of various types as well as enforcing OAuth2 scopes grants for specific endpoints.

Example of use: https://github.com/neoeinstein/aliri/blob/master/aliri_tower/examples/axum.rs

## Solution

Add link to `aliri_tower` into the ecosystem documentation.

title: Change `Handler` to have an associated `Future` type
body:
This removes `#[async_trait]` from `Handler` and replaces that with an
associated `Future` type.

As hinted at in #878 I'm working on something with types that need to
implement `Handler`. I'm doing that by wrapping other `Handler` types so
I can implement `Handler` by simply delegating and thus don't need to
allocate another box for `#[async_trait]`. This change makes that
possible.

It does make `Handler` less ergonomic to implement but thats a very
niche feature so I'm fine with that. It wouldn't be appropriate for
`FromRequest` IMO.

Fix out of date docs for `Json`

title: Don't set extension we never use

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

body: Quick clean up. I noticed we set `RouteId` as an extension but never used it. Probably a holdover from an other implementation.

title: Update to matchit 0.5
body: No changes other than cleaning up matchit's api.

title: Fix routing for opaque nested services
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/830

This brings nesting of opaque services inline with nesting `Router`s, except for one case which is explained in a test. Also added a bunch more comments to the prefix stripping so I'll still be able to understanding it two days from now 😅

title: Fix nesting of opaque services that paths that contain params
body:
While working on https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/830 I discovered that nesting opaque services at paths that contain params was totally broken. Things like

```rust
let api_routes = Router::new().route("/:b", get(|| async {})).boxed_clone();
let app = Router::new().nest("/:a", api_routes);
```

We would try and strip the prefix as `/:a` but thats a placeholder that should match anything. It shouldn't be used as the literal prefix.

This required some changes to [`StripPrefix`](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/main/axum%2Fsrc%2Frouting%2Fstrip_prefix.rs). I also added a bunch more tests and some property tests to get better coverage against panics.

title: Add security note about `extract::Host`
body: As discussed in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/827 users should take care to validate the value extracted by `Host`. This adds a note about that to the docs.

title: Implement `IntoResponseParts` for `Option<T>`
body: Been thinking that it might be convenient if `Option<T>` implements `IntoResponseParts` so you can conditionally add headers or extensions.

title: Use `IntoResponse` rather than `Response::builder` internally

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

body: This cleans up a few instances of `Response::builder` used internally and replaces them with `IntoResponse`. I personally think its a bit cleaner.

title: Make it more obvious that `NEST_TAIL_PARAM` is reserved
Refactor storing URL params in extensions
body: I've been working on https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/678 but did refactoring of path params first. Thought I'd submit that as its own PR to make reviewing easier.

title: ci: Set CARGO_TERM_COLOR = always to get colored logs
Replace set_var usage in examples
body:
## Motivation

`set_var`'s safety is at odds with `std` calling into libc which can read the environment without taking a lock at basically any point. Rust is moving towards deprecating the ability to call it in safe code, or the whole function (which approach wins is not yet decided AFAIK).

## Solution

Don't use `set_var`. It's possible to supply a default value to the tracing_subscriber `EnvFilter` if `RUST_LOG` isn't set in different ways (I have taken the easiest approach I could find).

Side note: The examples are a bit inconsistent about whether they

* Initialize `tracing_subscriber` with a `RUST_LOG` fallback value
* Initialize `tracing_subscriber` without `RUST_LOG` fallback
* Don't initialize `tracing_subscriber` at all

Should we initialize it the same way everywhere?

title: Add Host extractor
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

This pr closes #826, implementing the host extractor.

## Solution

1. Check the host portion of the `uri` to see if it's already been provided, returning if it has
2. Read from the `"host"` header value and return if it was present
3. Return an empty string if neither strategy yielded a value

title: Add example for implementing `IntoResponseParts`
body: Figure this might be good to have.

title: Fix inconsistent double slash when nesting routes
body:
Previously `.nest("/foo/", Router::new().route("/bar", _))` would result in `/foo//bar` which was inconsistent and broke other use cases described in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/714.

This fixes that so the deduplication of slashes is done consistently.

Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/714

title: Requires paths start with a `/`
body: Previously we only guarded against empty paths while paths like `:foo` were accepted.

title: Add note about order of extractors in the reverse-proxy example
body:
## Motivation

When building a proxy handler based on the `reverse-proxy` example, I ran into an error because I put the `Request<Body>` extractor before my `Extension` extractors.

## Solution

Add a note to the `reverse-proxy` example that the order of the extractors is relevant and `Request<Body>` needs to come last.

title: Replace HasRoutes with Into<Router>
body:
I think `HasRoutes` in axum-extra is pretty neat. It allows users to build their own abstractions for building routes and have them work directly with axum. I've been thinking that for 0.5 we should promote the trait to live in axum.

This is partly driven by some talks @LucioFranco and I have been having about possibly moving tonic's routing to axum in a more public way. Tonic currently reinvents a bunch of middleware stuff that axum already handles. That'd also give users more flexibility in how they compose their gRPC services. Such a change could have tonic implement `HasRoutes` for its services so they'd work with `axum::Router::merge`. However there are no concrete plans so its mostly speculation on my part.

I don't see much downside to this. `Router` implements `HasRoutes` so everything works like it used to.

@jplatte what do you think?

title: Implement `IntoResponseParts` for tuples
body:
This is quite a niche feature but worth having imo.

Currently you can use tuples of `IntoResponseParts` with up to 16 elements. This adds `IntoResponseParts` impls for tuples such that they can be infinitely nested and you can return more 16 response parts:

```rust
fn handler() -> impl crate::response::IntoResponse {
    (
        Extension(1),
        Extension(2),
        Extension(3),
        Extension(4),
        Extension(5),
        Extension(6),
        Extension(7),
        Extension(8),
        Extension(9),
        Extension(10),
        Extension(11),
        Extension(12),
        Extension(13),
        Extension(14),
        Extension(15),
        // these count as one but actually contain two parts
        (Extension(16), Extension(17)),
        "body",
    )
}
```

We have similar impls for [`FromRequest`](https://docs.rs/axum/latest/axum/extract/trait.FromRequest.html#impl-FromRequest%3CB%3E-for-()) as well.

title: Add cookie management to axum-extra
Remove `IntoResponse` and `IntoResponseParts` impls for `Version`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/802

Probably quite niche. We can always add the impls back if someone has a use case.

title: Make `IntoResponseParts` more flexible
body:
I've been thinking that `IntoResponseParts` could be useful for adding cookies, flash messages, or more high level things to the response. Something like:

```rust
(
    Cookie::new("key", "value"),
    Cookie::new("key-2", "value-2"),
    flash::error("something went wrong"),
    response,
)
```

I think this is nicer than something like [tower-cookies](https://docs.rs/tower-cookies/latest/tower_cookies/index.html) which uses a middleware and a `Drop` implementation to set the cookies. This approach should compose more nicely and not require any middleware.

That made me think that `ResponseParts` probably isn't quite flexible enough since it only allows inserting headers and extensions. You can't check for existing values, or call any other methods on `HeaderMap` or `Extensions`.

So this makes the following changes:

- Add `extensions(_mut)` and `headers(_mut)` methods to `ResponseParts`. The `*_mut` methods users can `std::mem::take` them and replace the existing ones but I think thats fine as it makes things much more flexible.
- Add an associated error type to `IntoResponseParts`. I think handling errors, for example when converting things into headers, this way is cleaner. The new method signature `fn into_response_parts(self, res: ResponseParts) -> Result<ResponseParts, Self::Error>` is a bit of a mouthful but at least it forces the caller to check the result vs something like `fn(&mut ResponseParts) -> Result<(), _>` which makes it possible to discard the error.

title: Using fully qualified path for Extension
body:
## Motivation

I was updating code after noticing new warnings of deprecations, and I tried to change my usage from AddExtensionLayer to `axum::Extension`, only to find that the type wasn't found.

## Solution

I updated the deprecation message to point to the fully qualified path. It appears this is re-exported in main, but not in 0.4.x. I'm not sure if this should be preferred to exporting it at the new location, but it seemed like the safer fix.

title: Export `AddExtension` from `middleware`
body:
Keeps the root a bit more tidy.

Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/810

title: Backport `TypedPath::to_uri`
body: Backports https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/790 to 0.4.x

title: axum: Version 0.4.7
body:
- **added:** Implement `tower::Layer` for `Extension` ([#801])
- **changed:** Deprecate `AddExtensionLayer`. Use `Extension` instead ([#805])

[#801]: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/801
[#805]: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/805

title: Remove `AddExtensionLayer`
body: Its deprecated on 0.4.x so we can remove it from `main`.

title: Fix some `examples/*` little problems.
body:
## Motivation
Unused dependencies
Miss docs: `cargo run -p example...`


## Solution
Some examples use `println!("Playground: http://localhost:3000")` but `trace`, so I just delete `trace` and `tracing-subscriber` dependencies.
Some examples import `axum-extra`,but never use it, so I just delete it.
`examples/chat` use neither `trace` nor `prinltn`, so I add some `trace` behavior.
`/examples/async-graphql` miss docs `cargo run -p example...` liking other examples,so I add doc add the code top.

Here are lists:
- `examples/chat` deps `trace` and `tracing-subscriber` never be used. Add trace `debug` to `chat`
- remove `examples/reverse-proxy` unused dependencies `tracing-subscriber` and `trace`
- remove `examples/prometheus-metrics` unused dependency `axum-extra`
- remove `examples/print-request-response` unused dependency `axum-extra`
- remove `examples/async-graphql` unused dependencies `tracing-subscriber` and `trace`
- Add docs to `/examples/async-graphql`, just like other examples.

title: Backport impl `tower::Layer` for `Extension`
body: Backports https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/801 to 0.4.x and deprecates `AddExtensionLayer`.

title: Move `Extension` into root
body: Same as https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/803 but for `Extension`.

title: Move `TypedHeader` into root
body: Like `Json`, `TypedHeader` is now both an extractor and a response so this moves it into the root and exports it from both `extract` and `response`.

title: Implement `tower::Layer` for `Extension`
body:
As discussed in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/797 `Extension` can actually implement `tower::Layer`. This means users only need to know one type to apply the extensions and extract them. Makes the API a bit smaller.

I think I'm gonna backport this with a deprecation for `AddExtensionLayer`, and then remove it on `main`. I'll do that when this is merged.

title: Add `IntoResponseParts`
axum-macros: use fully qualified Result type
body:
# Motivation

It is pretty common to define custom `Result<T>` type aliases however the typed_path macros generate `Result<T, E>` on the assumption they are imported from the std prelude. Having the type aliases defined causes errors like:

     #[derive(TypedPath, Deserialize)]
              ^^^^^^^^^
              |
              expected 1 generic argument
              help: remove this generic argument

## Solution

Generate fully qualified `std::result::Result` return types.

title: Improve error for missing extension
body: Just saw https://www.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/t070uj/axum_post_error/ which made realize that it probably would be more helpful if the error for missing extensions mentioned `AddExtensionLayer`.

title: fix `examples/todos`'s `async fn todos_index` iter_overeager_cloned
body:
## Motivation
fix `examples/todos`'s `async fn todos_index` [iter_overeager_cloned](https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#iter_overeager_cloned)

It’s often inefficient to clone all elements of an iterator.
> `iter.clone().skip(..).take(..)` 


## Solution
remove unneeded `clone` by
replacing `iter.clone().skip(..).take(..)` with `iter.skip(..).take(..).clone()`

title: Remove outdated documentation for `BodyStream` and `RawBody`
body:
Fixes: #792

## Motivation

Docs for `extract::{BodyStream, RawBody}` mention that you can use `hyper::Body` as well to extract the body but that's not true since the introduction of axum-core that doesn't depend on hyper and therefor doesn't implement `FromRequest` for `hyper::Body` 

## Solution

Removed the relevant lines from the docs

title: Update to tokio-tungstenite 0.17
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/781

title: Easily convert typed paths into URIs
body:
`#[derive(TypedPath)]` will now also generate `TryFrom<_> for Uri` for
easily converting paths into URIs for use with `Redirect` and friends.

Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/789

title: axum-extra: fix typo in CHANGELOG.md
body:

Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.

title: Fix some out of date docs
body:
Since https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/698 this section about
`HeaderMap` removing the headers from the request is no longer true.

title: Document sharing state between handler and middleware
body: A few people have asked about this so I figure it makes sense to document somewhere.
